title: Kayseri Castle
text: Kayseri Castle, is a castle built in <a href="Classical%20antiquity">antiquity</a> and first mentioned in a coin during the rule of <a href="Gordian%20III">Gordian III</a> between 238 and 244 <a href="AD">AD</a>. It went through multiple additions starting with the <a href="Ancient%20Rome">Romans</a>, continuing with the <a href="Byzantine%20Greeks">Byzantines</a>, <a href="Danishmends">Danishmends</a>, <a href="Seljuqs">Seljuqs</a>, <a href="Beylik%20of%20Dulkadir">Dulqadirs</a>, <a href="Karamanids">Karamanids</a>, and <a href="Ottomans">Ottomans</a>. The castle, located in the eponymous <a href="Kayseri">city</a>, is made of an inner and an outer section with a total of 18 towers.
